CATASTROPHE.Definition: a big disaster or very bad event

CONGRESS.Definition: a large meeting of people who make laws or big decisions

LANDMARK.Definition: an event marking an important stage or turning point

STRUCTURAL.Definition: relating to how it is built or put together

EXHAUST PIPE.Definition: the tube at the back of a car where smoke comes out

SUSTAINABLY.Definition: in a way that can go on without hurting nature

FLIP SIDE.Definition: another way to look at it

ROOTS.Definition: the parts of a plant under the ground

PLANKTON.Definition: tiny plants or animals in the sea

WEATHERING.Definition: the process of wind, rain, or ice breaking down rocks

SUCK.Definition: pull in, like with a vacuum

COMPOUNDS.Definition: things made of two or more parts

LOOP.Definition: a circle, something that goes around again and again

SEDIMENT.Definition: small pieces of dirt or sand that sink in water

VACCINES.Definition: medicine or shots that help stop people from getting sick

NICHE.Definition: interesting or appealing to a small, specialised section of the population

SCATTER.Definition: throw them around in different places

IN THE GRAND SCHEME OF THINGS.Definition: looking at the big picture, considering everything

UMBRELLA.Definition: something that covers or includes many things

SOLVENT.Definition: a liquid that can dissolve other things

RETROFITTING.Definition: adding new parts to something old to make it better

SAWDUST.Definition: tiny bits of wood made when cutting

BRANCHES.Definition: the parts of a tree that grow out from the trunk
